content.question: Which of the following changes in conditions could account for the difference in the time for the reaction to go to completion in trial <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> </math> ?

choices.label: The mixture of reactants was stirred in trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, but not in trial <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.
The temperature of the hydrochloric acid was higher in trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
The concentration of the hydrochloric acid was greater in trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
The solid magnesium was a fine powder in trial <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> but a single chunk in trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

content.answer: The solid magnesium was a fine powder in trial <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> but a single chunk in trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

skill.text: 2.F: Explain how modifications to an experimental procedure will alter results.
